intro: Oenothera autranii, commonly known as the Brazilian evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by moths and other nocturnal insects. Oenothera autranii is known for its ornamental value and has been cultivated for its beautiful blooms.
